page.title: 07Fallow deer.
page.content: We talked to a Forest Ranger and to a Countryside Ranger to find out more about the fallow deer. The fallow deer of the Chase are truly wild, for herds roamed the area long before the first Domesday Book was written and the Chase created. The herd is maintained at about 300 animals, the limiting factor being the amount of winter keep that is available. Deer can cause damage to young trees by eating the young shoots and leaves, and by the bucks rubbing their antlers on the lower branches. In winter they can also destroy crops when they invade neighbouring farmland in their search for food. The main danger to deer comes from traffic using the roads that cross the Chase, and many are killed or injured each year.
